channel.title: Summary :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: In this chapter we discussed many of the possible authentication strategies for web applications, as well as the strengths and drawbacks. To reiterate the most salient points: Passwords should NEVER be stored as plain text! Authentication processes should follow current industry best-practices. This is not the place to experiment! Industry best practices are constantly changing, as ever-improving computer technology renders older techniques ineffective Following these guidelines can help keep your users safe and secure.
